Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: smile4u56584
Reviews.Content: First if you are a government employee and use this for the rate, you will be given a hanidcapped room. I would go with the Westin's government rate because they don't stick you in a hideous handicapped room facing the parking garage. The coffee maker didn't work, the bell hops never showed to pick up our luggage, the maids were loud in the hallway, i had to ask them to be quiet at 8 am. I chose this hotel to be close to the event, but if I had it to do over I would have stayed with the Westin and drove a bit longer. The Pool was suppose to be heated but if was cold. There were dead plants in the pool area. If the Hilton chains keep this rate up Paris Hilton will be shopping at Walmart in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: Ietsgotravel
Reviews.Content: It was fine and that's it. Attended a conference here. Conference facilities were good. The elevators are close by the meeting rooms so made it easy and quick to run to your room on breaks. Valet and bell staff friendly and accommodating while desk staff was ok. No type of welcome greeting as a silver Honors member or even a smile - I was simply processed at check-in. Surprising, as I stay at a lot of Hilton properties and am usually warmly greeted. Room was average, a little on the smallish side. Bed was comfy, room was quiet. Desk chair old and a little rickety. Bathroom was nice but toilet had not been cleaned thoroughly (yuck!), toilet seat hinge was broken and moved a lot and towel rack was pulled out of the wall. Obviously housekeeping staff doesn't care. Bath towels big and soft. Room service menu limited with no healthy choices. Evening desk girl sent me to a raw food cafe called Bliss which was great and a short walk. This property needs some work!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: funmom2go
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Everything I want in a hotel, attentive service, clean, good bed and pillows. The breakfast buffet was quite good. My daughter and I enjoyed our stay. I typically won't stay at a hotel that allows pets, I've had bad experiences at properties that allow them. I wanted to stay at a nice hotel with good proximity to Love Field so I decided to take a chance. I did however request a room that didn't allow pets. I do like animals, I have three of them, I just don't like staying in rooms that have had them. I doubt that would have been a problem at this hotel. It was quite clean. We didn't have a good view, not sure if there are great views here, the hotel is amongst many tall buildings. We didn't care about the view, only the quality of the room. The valet service was very good. When we arrived I told them we would be coming back out in about 30 minutes, my car was waiting. The next morning I called just a few minutes before leaving the room, it again was waiting. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet hotel near SMU, Northpark Mall and Highland Park Village”
Reviews.Author: lesliz64
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights when I was visiting SMU for a conference. Only one computer/printer in the business center. Everything else was great. Experienced a wine/cheese/fruit reception the first night as well as a full plated dinner. Both were excellent. The dinner consisted of a strawberry/feta/walnut salad, grilled salmon and beef tenderloin, roasted vegetables and delicious, fresh rolls. The room was large and well decorated with up to date linens and a flat screen TV. There were four pillows on the bed (2 fluffy ones and 2 feathery ones). The bathroom was also large and included toiletries, a magnifying makeup mirror and good lighting. The best thing about the bathroom were the towels....they were not those that barely wrap around you and come undone the minute you lift your arms (don't know if anyone else has this problem, but I do!) These were thick towels that wrapped around me one and a half times! Floors in bath area were marble and shower had good pressure. There was a Starbucks adjoining the hotel that you could access right from the lobby which is also roomy but cozy and very traditionally furnished. Elevators were quick and outfitted with dark wood. I stayed on the 11th floor and the workout facility was at the end of the hall. It had new equipment and also included a small outdoor pool that was heated and felt great at night after a hard day's work. I am taking my daughter on a shopping/SMU college visit this summer and we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Northpark, West Village, Galleria . . . the LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Park Cities is not a glamorous hotel, but let's face it . . . Dallas isn't exactly where one would go to "see" the most beautiful scenery in the world. HOWEVER, the shopping is a different story and this hotel is in a PERFECT location. Situated just off the North Dallas Tollway, we were able to get to the Galleria, Northpark, West Village, and even Javier's (awesome restaurant) without a huge hassle. Anyone who has ever visited the Metroplex knows that time spent behind the wheel is an accepted way of life . . . everything is FAR! So, this hotel made our drive time(s) less and the fact that it is tucked away from the HEAVY traffic made it seem like an oasis. Our room was on the concierge level and provided everything needed . . . snacks, internet access, and solitude. Now, there's always room for improvement and this hotel needs some cosmetic attention . . . the fixture on the shower felt as if it might come off in my hand and was really not easy to manipulate. When I went over to turn on the lamp near the chair . . . the socket was hanging by a wire! And, if one is staying on the club level, and paying for the mandatory valet . . . it's really kind of greedy to charge for a glass of wine. It's either club level, or it's not . . . In all, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to have a convenient location to stay while doing some serious damage shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Clean but dated and underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: hobo_ent
Reviews.Content: At Hilton you expect a certain standard and that standard has been achieved, just barely. This Valet Only (in this neighborhood too!) hotel features a nice lobby and rooms that could be deemed spacious. My disappointment here (other than the mandatory valet in a city where you have to drive everywhere) was the dated feeling in my room and the "pool". While the room did have a LCD TV, the desk chair looked like it hadn't been replaced in decades. Mine actually was broken and leaned forward and to the right. After a meeting, I decided to go to the roof pool for a couple of laps. That turned out to be a couple of laughs as the pool was three feet deep and approximately 4'X8'. The staff was great, but I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service , poor amenities, boring decor.”
Reviews.Author: tally11111
Reviews.Content: While the room was clean and comfortable, there were few amenities in and around the property. The service in restaurant was awful as we waited 30 minutes for a server to take our order and the lobby bar was unstaffed in the evening. The decor was dated, run down and just boring. The gym small and crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location for Our Purposes”
Reviews.Author: Z-Man_Chicago
Reviews.Content: My uncle in Dallas passed away suddenly and we had to book our flights and accommodations on very short notice. I was traveling with my wife. The service was to be held at a parlor not far from the SMU campus on Northwest Highway and I had stayed at the Hilton Dallas Park Cities property on business 9 or so years ago, so we booked a room for one night. It was a smaller Hilton, tucked away in an older structure off the main street. Nice exterior architectural detail but very small lobby with a bar and small restaurant on the main floor. There's also a Starbuck's coffee outlet as well that's open in the morning. The rooms were smallish. The bath was prosaic. Service was good and dependable. It can best be described as a clean, comfortable place to lay down your head if you happen to need to be on that side of Dallas. We recently joined AAA and Hilton offers discounts for AAA members. The price without taxes was under $170/night. But the parking added $25/night. All in all, it was fairly reasonable. The location, however, was really great. It's near restaurants and high end shopping. And it's not far from highway access. We flew into DFW, which is about 30 to 40 minutes away by car. But if you were coming into Love Field, it would be perfect. The property is certainly not a destination. But it's a good, "sturdy" place to hang your hat for a night or two in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a gorgeous Hilton”
Reviews.Author: true7
Reviews.Content: What a beatiful property, with well appointed and clean rooms. In a great area that is near almost everything you need. The staff was all proffesional and on point with what we needed. Great property and I will look to stay here again the next time I am in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant small hotel in a good neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: The primary appeal of the Hilton Park Cities is its location. It's three miles from the airport -- Love Field (DAL), not DFW -- and a couple of miles from SMU. Within a five-minute walk are lots of stores and restaurants: during my seven or eight stays here I've shopped at Joseph A Banks, Ross, CVS, and a branch of the well-stocked discount-shoe chain whose three initials I can never remember, and I've eaten at California Pizza Kitchen, Chipotle, and La Madeleine, along with a Texas-flavor barbecue/seafood place and a taqueria. The hotel also has an unremarkable but pleasant in-house restaurant and bar. This is among the older and smaller Hiltons I've encountered, but it's well kept and comfortable. The rooms and bathrooms are large, nicely furnished, and impeccably clean; the lobby is both dignified and inviting. I've found the room rates to be quite reasonable for a Hilton in a major U.S. city. The Executive Lounge serves a decent breakfast and a satisfactory array of hors d'oevres in the evening for guests on the executive (tenth) floor. As in most Hiltons in the United States, wine and other alcoholic beverages in the lounge are not free. The exercise room is small but functional; the rooftop pool is fine for lounging but too small for swimming. The staff at the Hilton Park Cities are awfully nice. The front desk staff in particular are capable, cheerful, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Stately hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGal10
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are nice and well-appointed. I love the Peter Thomas Roth bath products and the location cannot be beat. Close to SMU and walking distance to decent lunch places. The hotel bar was good, although small. They serve a buffet lunch which does not appeal to me, but seemed to be well-visited by local business people. My only complaint is that the wifi service is terrible. I could not get wifi in my guestroom and it was intermittent in the hotel conference rooms. If they improve the wifi, which is a must for business travelers, my rating would improve.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good trip”
Reviews.Author: dgrightfield
Reviews.Content: For a business traveler they really screwed things up, should be so basic. The parking is impossible and they require everyone to valet, though the signage is awful so it is hard to figure out. The wifi is AWFUL and does not work in the rooms, so here I sit at midnight in the lobby trying to send basic emails. Finally, to add insult to injury they bumped a few of my colleagues to another Hilton hotel at the last-minute. All in all, the hotel was just not good, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First class Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RLT45
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hilton last weekend. Everyone that we encountered that worked there went out of their way to make us feel at home. We ate breakfast at the hotel and it was excellent. I know there are a lot of places to stay in Dallas but we will go out of our way to stay at the Hilton Dallas/Park Cities Hotel when we go back to Big D.

Reviews.Title: “Totally standard clean hotel with a decent gym”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: Be sure to ask for a room other than the ones that directly face a multi-story parking garage- unless you enjoy staring out at a cement wall. There is a tiny rooftop pool, which is nice, and a gym that includes free weights and medicine balls.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jagluiperd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel for a few days and found the Hotel value for money. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very clean with all the amenities. The Hotel was easy to find and navigate in Dallas due to easy access to main roads. We ordered room service and the food was delicious. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: lillah19
Reviews.Content: I have been in this part of Dallas more times than I can count and have never even noticed this hotel. It is nestled on a side street among office buildings. I love the location as it truly is walking distance to shops and very close by Northpark. I had an early morning flight at Love Field and there was a taxi waiting and the front desk staff correctly told me $15 for the fare. The bar/restaurant is great. it is dark and library like with several tvs. The salads are huge and the burgers are juicy and tasty- highly recommended for a drink or quick meal. The rooms are a nice size with typical Hilton decor, comfortable beds and flat screen tvs. Still no wireless Internet but no big deal. Large bathrooms with good showers and plenty of towels. I will definitely return when I need to visit this part of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: notab
Reviews.Content: Stay here for business once in a while and always enjoy the stay. Parking is somewhat an issue if you don't take the 20/day route but otherwise it's a good location to explore. Swimming pool and fitness center is larger than expected however there is no wifi included.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, if rather undifferentiated.”
Reviews.Author: Architectandmusician
Reviews.Content: This is a well-located, if undifferentiated hotel, given the price. Room decor could use some updating. The rooms have hard-wired Internet but no wireless Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Dallas Park City Area”
Reviews.Author: fishpicturesbybob
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on a mid week visit to Dallas. It appeared that most of the guests were business travelers. We traveled to Dallas by car and we were aware prior to arrival that the hotel does not have self parking. The parking valet was prompt and we were pleased with check in which took no time at all. We forgot a laptop in the trunk of the car which we noticed during check in and the valet had it to us before we left the check in desk. We had requested a standard room with a king bed. The room was very spacious with a separate area with table and chairs as well as a comfortable sitting area and a work desk. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel does not furnish Internet access and they charge for connection to the wired internet access. Wireless in the rooms was not available. We were also charged $22 for our Valet parking which when you add tips for the in and out service ran the parking to over $30. The room came with breakfast for the two of us and they had an excellent buffet which was a plus. They also had a coffee bar with rolls and such which we noticed being used by a number of guests that must not have had a room with breakfast. We will stay here again on our visits to this area in Dallas but we will search a little prior to our next visit to find an equal hotel that does not charge for parking or Internet and if we find this we will change hotels.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and great vacation options”
Reviews.Author: TravelKeen83
Reviews.Content: warm hospitality... great mexican food options... the cook is happy to experiment with your suggestions and present it well... balconies in most rooms with a view of the hotel's gold course, swimming pool and gardens helps... the fitness centre is pretty huge... overall a very nice and sunny experience..

Reviews.Title: “Very Strange, but the hotel is nice”
Reviews.Author: lufcpaul1
Reviews.Content: I was asked if I could leave the lobby, my wife was asked to move to the other side of the road - All beacuse a college football team was arriving. I can understand if it was the President. "sir can you move round the corner" What so a college football team does not see me!! The hotel is great, the staff (when they are not trying to move you out of the way) are great and overall was a very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, large enough to have all the extras”
Reviews.Author: Bill_Radio61
Reviews.Content: and still feel like a boutique hotel. Sevice is great, always referred to me by name. The bed so comfy it was hard to get up in the morning. Prices were extremely reasonable, and the Sunday buffet was really good. My son is 14 and they still charged him as a child. He is on the thin side so they probably knew he would not eat lots. The geography is awesome. Next to Tollway, nesteled in the Park City shopping area, which is pretty upscale.

Reviews.Title: “good place for a daytime tryst”
Reviews.Author: Melina1222
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers unadvertised daytime specials - check in for a few hours, leave before 5 or so, and you only pay half price for your room. You probably won't get a room with a terrific view, but it's more than adequate for grownup mischief.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: IcebergDeeva
Reviews.Content: I thought the staff was absolutely great. They treated me AND my little dog amazingly. I was surprised, however, that the room was not totally clean when I checked in. There was left over melted water in the ice bucket from the prior guests? Hmm. The facilities, also, were a little disappointing. Although this should be a full service hotel, the restaurant looked a little more like a sports bar. I mistakenly went looking for another. I was redirected back to this one. The food was good. The atmosphere just wasn't what I was expecting for a hotel in Highland Park. The pictures are a little deceiving (the valet and bellmen do not dress like they appear on the website). HILTON, ARE YOU STILL CHARGING FOR INTERNET? (9.95 PLUS TAX TO BE EXACT) Was that a mistake?! I was also charged for two LOCAL calls! LOL. The HHonors points are great. The service is great. The hotel is a little dated (and not necessarily in a vintage kind of way). Would I stay here again? Only because of the staff. BTW, the Vanilla/Cinnamon French Toast that I ordered for room service was DIVINE!

Reviews.Title: “Four Diamond?”
Reviews.Author: Mncs1983
Reviews.Content: Because I often choose hotels based on their aaa diamond ratings, I was looking forward to staying at this four diamond property. The rooms were clean, check-in agents were friendly, but I have stayed at quite a few four diamond properties and this one doesn't seem to measure up. No wireless access in the rooms, only an Ethernet cable! That was one of the factors, besides the overall look and feel of the hotel, that definitely aged it. Great location to Northpark mall and Preston Center, but an outrageous $22 parking fee. Am I in San Francisco? I woke up at 6am to the clanking of my neighbors shower, air conditioner, and door slamming. The walls were definitely thin! Probably would not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great night ruined by 1 thing”
Reviews.Author: mttmilner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to spend some of our reward points here for a little getaway from reality for the night. Everything went very well except for our valet experience. There was a conference either going on at the hotel or close by and quite a few people attending were staying here. In the morning when we went to get the car from the valet it was raining and just overall nasty weather. There were other people getting their car from the valet and all their cars were being driven up close to the hotel being pulled up under the awning to keep the guests out of the rain. The cars were all very nice (Lexus, Benz). However when the valet brought our car up (Chevy Aveo) he parked it in the middle of the street and made my wife and I walk out and get wet to get the car. Needless to say no tip for him.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly average”
Reviews.Author: gentah
Reviews.Content: There wasn't anything special about the hotel. The beds and room were fine. The bedding nice. The tile in the bathroom seemed a little old--grout dark in some places, crumbling or missing in others. The hotel is located not far from shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Customer Service, Delicious Free Breakfast, Shopping in walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: mjmartin006
Reviews.Content: I got a great price on priceline.com and wereally enjoyed staying at this hotel. The free breakfast was the best I have every had! Usually you are stuck with cold cereals, hard muffins, etc. Not this place! Fresh fruit, scrambled eggs, juice, etc. A big drawback was that they charged for internet service and it wasn't fast! It was so slow I never could get onto most websites, and add that frustration with having to pay extra for it, and that was a big downer. Another bad side was we had to pay $22 per day to park, plus tip the valets!! But on the plus side of that, it was nice knowing that your car wouldn't be broken into or stolen. Other than the parking and internet, is was a great place to stay. The staff was very friendly, they went our of their way to help, I would love to stay here again. We walked to several nice stores and places to eat in the area. It was a great 3 days!!

Reviews.Title: “Ugh”
Reviews.Author: Wink27
Reviews.Content: Great location, but I haven't slept in three days. The higher floors (executive levels) are plagued by very loud "chillers" - thump thump, thump thump, thump thump, all day and all night - felt like I was in a sci-fi movie. The desk staff acted like they had never heard of such a thing, but did move me - and the room was even louder (I am sure they were snickering at the desk). I waited a couple hours and just couldn't stand it, so went back down and thankfully, there was new staff. The person immediately knew of the problem, and cheerfully moved me as well as recommended where I should request for my next stay (city facing rooms, mid-level). I had also talked with other staff, nameless to prtect the innocent, and they all knew of the noise problem,,,no big secret apparently. Sigh, I was in heaven, until people started showering, at least that's what I think it is...the plumbing/water rushing/something noise is SO LOUD that I can't even hear the TV without putting the volume on full blast. I am tempted to record it is so loud. Then, when the noise stops, the TV is BLARING. OMG, I can't wait to go home tomorrow. Full house, so they claim no more rooms at the inn....ugh...what a horrible week.

Reviews.Title: “The total experience was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: waltersc316
Reviews.Content: Everything - check-in, valet parking, guest rooms and service - was absolutely fantastic. I was attending a wedding with the family & guests housed at the hotel and the reception at the adjacant Park Cities Club. The hotel staff did an outstanding job! Very classy, clean, comfortable and great service!

Reviews.Title: “There is "No Policy" re: steeling from guests”
Reviews.Author: JAA-Dallas
Reviews.Content: I recently hosted a group of friends who came to Dallas to celebrate my birthday. I created some fun gift bags with to welcome by friends to Dallas and left them at the front desk with specific instructions for them to be provided to the guests when they checked into the hotel. Unfortunately brother had to cancel his trip and his reservation at the hotel. When I went to the hotel the next morning, to retreive his uncliamed gift, the front desk staff was not able to locate the contents of the gift bag, even though the tissue and bag were in the trash can. When I contacted hotel management of the situation I was told that there was "no policy" regarding what happened to items left at the front desk and that the staff usually took them on a "first come" basis.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip for party”
Reviews.Author: stlanne
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed in this hotel was 7 years ago when my daughter and I were looking at SMU. My daughter stayed in Dallas for a job after college and invited me to a party. I decided to stay at the same hotel. the front desk was very helpful. The room was was at the end of a hall. It was clean and well lit. The bathroom was roomy and well appointed. The executive level had a nice breakfast - fluffy scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, nice assortment of baked goods. I think the lobby and common areas had a face lift - everything was light and bright and new. It is in walking distance of some cute boutiques.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel. Nothing bad to report. Nice employees!”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaSuz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Dallas last night, where we had gone to attend a family wedding. We loved our stay at the Hilton Dallas Park Cities. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and quiet. The employees were all nice. The young guys that valet park your car could not have been more courteous! I left something in my car several times and they were nice enough to accompany to my car so that I could retrieve what I needed. Super nice guys!!! We had a room on the 10th floor. It was a quiet as could be. It is the executive floor with access to the concierge lounge. We had wonderful breakfast and evening snacks included in the concierge lounge. We watched football games on the TV there and visited with family and friends there. Our room was nice. Nothing fabulous, but nice. It was very clean. I found the bed uncomfortable, but that is because I am used to my foam mattress at home. Inner spring mattresses no longer feel comfortable to me. The neighborhood was nice. There was shopping within walking distance, but we didn't even know it until the day we left. It was so quiet on the streets around the hotel. My niece's wedding reception was at the Park City Club. We walked there from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very COMFORTABLE...genuine care....lots of smiles!”
Reviews.Author: Freezeone
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. This stay was superior. Warm reception at BAR, reception, Starbucks and PBX. Night auditor...not so much. Impeccable housekeeping, lobby attendant, lobby concierge, and valet. Bar menu could use more healthy and/or dietary relavant items like "meatless" tapas. Starbucks brew was not bold enough for this java lover...had to get the real thing a mile away. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Nice Hotel-SMU Parents Weekend”
Reviews.Author: JosephL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the suggestion of SMU for Parents Weekend. We did not notice any noise problems-through walls, from street (we were on 7 but on the street side), AC, etc. Staff was attentive and helpful but when it comes to dinner suggestions, etc they had minimal answers. Ate breakfast twice in the restaurant-food and service were very good, price is no value. Free wireless in lobby only, in the room it's not free and cable. This is a negative.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spino80
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel when you have to so Business in the Dallas dow town area afiwfjwfnkjnfknafkbnfbkfbqkjfbkjqbfkjqbefjkwbfkjqbfkjbkfjbqkjbqkjdbqkjdbkjqbdkjqbdkjqbfdkjabdmnwbnlkfjwrlfgjlwkrfnlkwkwqbdjkhsbfjdwnlkfjnwoifnwkjfnkljwnfljwnflkwnfklwnklfnslcnaepkrgjopwjgfkwnfklÃ¶wmflÃ¶kwkÃ¶fmfwfwefwenflwklflkcds c,sd nkvjnwkjfnklwmflÃ¶csdmlkvnerougn3wmf.sfnkjwbfounwlkfn.ksnfklwnkofpowkflÃ¶smcvnio423flwmncvklsmnkonwapifmwÃ¼pfkopsfvoeanvwa

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: campr001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our daughter to Dallas for college orientation and registration. This hotel was suggested as a place to stay. However, we wish we had never even heard of the place! First of all, the room was completely and utterly dingy and dirty. There was literally an inch of dust across the top of the electrical outlet plates, not to mention even more dirt and dust along the baseboards. On our third night there, we were awakened at 4:30 AM by a drunk man across the hall banging on the door repeatedly, yelling obscenities. Apparently, he was looking for someone he thought had his car keys. We called the front desk to get security, which took at least 10 minutes before someone came. The problem here is that anyone can access the floors, even without a room key. Most nicer hotels now require a room key to activate the elevator up to the guest floors. We hope we never have to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great if you need to be near SMU”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: We were going to a wedding in the area and this is where the bride suggested we stay. I had actually stayed here years before prior to the facelift, so I can comment that it looks great. They put us on the second floor, Intitially I was disappointed and thought it would be noisy, but the hotel is on a quiet street. Plus, the room was on the same floor as the ballrooms---which would have been loud had they been holdng an event---so it had the same high ceilings. They were 12-16 feet high. The rooms was huge--everything is bigger in Texas, I suppose. The pool area is nice with modern furniture, but the pool itself isn't much more than a puddle. The workout room is awseome and the free water is such a classy touch. Much more the I expecte from your average Hilton. Valet was the only downside--expensive and rather surly workers, one of whom made our car reek of smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, noisy hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobLaw47
Reviews.Content: This Hilton, on the edge of Preston Center, offers nice rooms and an attentive staff, but paper thin walls. Good management can't solve this problem. It is built in. We heard coversations in the next room, the tv remote fall on the floor above us, toilets flushing at 3 am, and the swosh of the AC turning off and on. Even on a dead-end street we got garbage trucks backing up before 6 am. So if you stay here, ask for a room at the end of the hallway, away from the street. And bring ear plugs. Incidentally, I had 3 complaints when I last stayed at this Hilton and the manager wrote a nice note and fixed the 2 that were in his control. It's the building itself that's the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emilyspinach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a leisure trip to Dallas/Fort Worth. The staff was friendly and the room was spacious and clean. Best of all, we had a deal with breakfast included and we were on the executive floor! The area of the hotel is upscale. We walked to Sevy's Grill (great place) at night and felt perfectly safe. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, This Hilton Was Okay”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hilton Dallas/Park Cities over Thanksgiving weekend. Being from Dallas, I liked the fact that this hotel is centrally located in North Dallas, giving easy access to anywhere in the city you would want to go. Another plus are all of the great restaurants within walking distance. This is a charming, intimate Hilton property. The entrance and lobby area are typical of an upscale boutique hotel. The guys who work the valet are very friendly and energetic guys (there was a wedding at the hotel one night and they did a great job of professionally handling the backlog of vehicles). The young and good-looking front desk staff were just okay - they were pleasant, but definitely lacked the finesse of those who have a strong hospitality background. My main gripe with this experience was the room. The room was fine. But I was surprised that in 2009, the room still had an old style tube tv. Most hotels these days have flat screens. I was also disappointed with the hotel's Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries. They offer shampoo and conditioner, but no body wash. And I don't use bar soap. It's odd not to offer body wash; especially given the air travel restrictions with liquids. The room we were given on the 5th floor was located at the very end of the hallway and everytime the room above us would flush their toilet, you could hear the water and what it contained going through the pipes in the walls. Housekeeping did a fair job with the room, although they never did put away the iron board we had left out for 2 days in a row. Also, there were brown smears on the wall just above the toilet (gross!) Overall, this is a lovely hotel that we would stay at again. They just need to upgrade some of the offerings in the rooms and pay more attention to detail in regards to housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hilton Property!”
Reviews.Author: dknbeauchamp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property dozens of times over the past several years. It has always been a great experience! My friends and family are spoiled, too, from the times they have joined me at the Hilton Dallas/Park Cities. This most recent visit, I brought my two teenage nieces -- they swam, they slept late, they had room service, they had snacks on the Executive Floor, they flirted with the valet parking boys -- basically they had a perfect weekend! The property itself is beautifully appointed. It is conveniently located near great restaurants and shopping. The staff members are gracious and always greet me by name. Hilton Dallas/Park Cities is my favorite home-away-from-home and I look forward to staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: auggiemctavish
Reviews.Content: A little hard to find, but a nice Hilton. There seemed to be a lot of staff at this hotel, I did not find them to be unfriendly as other posters have commented. The room was clean though the shower curtain had a damp musty odor. I agree the price of the valet was a bit much, there are no other options unless you are there during the day and want to park in a public lot a couple of blocks away. Not a bad choice.

Reviews.Title: “Bad and Rude Service - water problems”
Reviews.Author: yellowrose13
Reviews.Content: This is a neighborhood hotel with a decent reputation. We had power outages due to ice so went to this hotel for a warm night's sleep. Had no problem getting a room but had to negotiate a high rate down to something manageable. After all, I was a walk-in and not even asking for Hilton Honors points (I did not have my card with me). Don't fleece me on a rate when you did nothing to get me there. Room was fine until we tried to use the water. Getting hot water that night was an issue. The next morning there was hot water but significant problems with the water pressure. During my shower the water suddenly flowed to a trickle only to be followed by a blast of scalding water. After two instances I moved quickly to avoid getting hit again! This went on for the duration of the shower. After showering I pushed the Guest Services button on the phone. It does not connect you to anything. I then called the Front Desk. The call rang open and was then answered by a reservations agent in another state! She truly wanted to help and asked me to stay on the line. After an eternity she returned to the line and said someone from the hotel would contact me. I was irritated by the scaldings and by no one at the hotel seeming to be around to care. It seems that they will make sure the capture a reservation BUT NOT take care of you once you are there. About 15 minutes later there was a knock at the door. I opened it to find a man in street clothes with no hotel identification, and a woman who appeared to be from the hotel. The man rudely said to me: "We are here to talk to you." He never identified himself at all. It was as if he was the police and I was the criminal whom he intended to interrogate. That really irritated me. I recounted the problem and he went to check the shower. He kept asking me questions in a manner to say to me that "I do not believe you." He then asked brusquely if I needed medical attention. I asked him to leave as I needed to get dressed for the office. He was a jerk. I later told the situation to the Front Desk Clerk on duty and she seemed suprised I had a problem. And, did nothing. I'll drive elsewhere the next time I need a neighborhood hotel...or need to recommend one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TylerSwmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Park Cities over night before catching a flight out of Love Field. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was very professional and helpful. Very convenient for flying out of Love Field.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UthaSmula
Reviews.Content: The Staff were not friednly at all. There are no wireless in the rooms. The pool is only 3ft. and outside. The location is relly bad. The valet charges $18 a night, no self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Park Cities is Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TravelHM
Reviews.Content: Great service, beautiful rooms, over the top polite staff. Definitely in a great area of Dallas and in walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. Don't pass it up!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Patriot27
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a conference and got a rate of $169. The room was surprisingly very spacious - nice view of downtown Dallas in the distance. Overall the room quality was very good. The only negative was the lack of a wireless connection. The hotel has a restaurant and bar - the restaurant is the better of the two and has a great lunch menu - my colleagues loved the Texas size burger. Also within walking distance is California Pizza Kitchen and Houstons restaurant. The hotel's location is a bit odd - its located down a side straight and is situated amongst several businesses - its not located near an significant nightlife or major attractions. Its about a $15 cab ride to Dallas Love Field and $40 to DFW. I'd only recommend if your on a business trip or attending a conference.

Reviews.Title: “I had an amazing stay, would choose this hotel again.”
Reviews.Author: KSpade1982
Reviews.Content: I came to the Hilton Dallas/Park Cities on a business trip and it was probably the best hotel I could have chosen. The rooms were spacious and clean and there were enough chairs and tables so it wasnâ€™t a struggle for me to get my work done. They had high-speed wireless internet access and there were two speaker phones in the room too, which made it easier for me to talk to my clients. I could also surf the internet on the television. A business center was available downstairs. It was convenient for me to quickly make some copies and send some faxes before I went to my meeting. I would also highly recommend the OPIO Restaurant. The first night I ate at the OPIO I had something called the Truffled Lobster Corn Chowder, and from then on I tried to eat at there every night of my trip, I even brought some clients there too.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hilton”
Reviews.Author: PK_in_KC
Reviews.Content: This Hilton is okay .. was pretty clean, had interesting character. The rooms are average - there is no restaurant except for the bar with limited food. Parking is valet only (although the sign says there is a self-service parking option). I'll probably look for a different hotel in Dallas next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cgebhart
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton Dallas Park Cites Hotel for our Anniversary. The Location is great for Shopping at North Park Mall, and there is a unlimited dining with in minutes of the Hotel. We really enjoyed the new upgrades in the rooms and additions to the hotel. The service was excellent we would recommend this hotel to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “The best location and service”
Reviews.Author: trazoc
Reviews.Content: My organization held a multi day event at the HPC again this year. This was our 3rd visit to the hotel for similar events. We book and sponsor 1-3 day conferences, conventions and meetings in a four state area. We always choose nice, well known hotels as our venue. No other hotel comes close to the Hilton Park Cities for elegance, service and location. The rooms are comfortable, the catering is wonderful and the staff is so very accomodating. I can't say enough about this hotel and the staff. Whether hosting an event or just wanting a great hotel near all the best shopping and dinning, you won't find better than the Hilton Park Cities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel.. Perfect for what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: brandier1976
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. We stayed there for a cheerleading comp. and they bent over backwards to accommodate us. The front desk staff was very friendly and service is very quick. We called down for towels and they had them to our room within 5 mins., may have been less then that. The hotel was conveniently located to where ever we needed to go. The rooms were perfect for what we needed, I did not think they were small at all for a hotel. The beds were super comfy which I loved. This is a more upscale hotel so expect the prices to be higher. I would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice-Upscale -Not too Pricey-Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business. I don't know if they have a self park- there are a number of garages around the hotel - but they don't appear to be public ones. $18 Valet parking is not outrageous, though. It is near the Dallas tollway - convenient. The hotel is in what appears to be a safe - but not really "walkable" area. The interior of the hotel is nicely appointed. The rooms do not have the "worn" feeling many hotels have - seemed like the furnishings, etc. were relatively new. Hilton HHonor members get 2 free bottles of water, an upgrade to a larger size Starbucks coffee in the lobby ( woo-hoo!) and free access to the Concierge level for appetizers ( veggies, cheeses, jalapeno poppers, crackers, cookies, fruit) in the evening and an OK breakfast in the morning. Like some other reviewers, I had some problems with getting the wi-fi in my room to work. Ended up using my calling card. Turndown service with chocolates and the radio turned to a classical station was a pleasant surprise. Very clean bathroom and very comfy bed. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - would go back”
Reviews.Author: masewell
Reviews.Content: Stayed on two separate occasions over three weeks with a gov't rate of $123. This Hilton is a boutique Hotel situated two blocks from a very nice area of Dallas (Highland Park). If your stay allows you any time to check out the surrounding neighborhood - there are some decent restaurants and it seemed pretty safe. The local neighborhood, in my opinion, sets it apart from a majority of hotels in Dallas. As for the hotel itself - the main restaurant is nice albeit with the usual premium in-hotel prices - ditto for the bar. The room was a moderate size and the hotel was quiet. The exercise room had ellipticals/treadmills and a few free weights. The heated outdoor pool was tempting although the weather was a bit chilly (no matter how warm the water was.) The concierge level (10th floor) had a nice free continental breakfast spread and a nightly hors d'oeuvres with cash bar. There were also two computers w/free internet and printer. In-room internet was 9.95 a night +tax. Eventually - my travels will take me back to Dallas again - I'll likely stay here too.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: kingsberry
Reviews.Content: The party I was in Dallas to attend had a group rate for this hotel, and I selected it because of the high praise it received on TripAdvisor. But I am thinking the ballot box may be stuffed here because I didn't find it to be anything special. The room was sizable, but come on, it's in Dallas not New York City. The room was clean, but I wouldn't stay in a hotel room that wasn't. I received no turn down service with chocolates on my pillow, nor a filled ice bucket, and I only got bottled water on the first day of our stay. There were no bathrobes in the room, as had been promised on the website, so I called and asked if some could be brought up to us. They arrived so much later that I had fallen asleep and was startled awake by a knock on the door. When I went to put the robe on, I found that they had not been fully dried and were still wet. A wet bathrobe is completely worthless! My husband said his breakfast from room service was just awful, the hash browns were the same as the frozen ones from McDonalds. He had horrible indigestion all morning from the greasiness. Mine was fine, but you can't go to far wrong when you stick to fruit and tea. The shower alternated between having plenty of hot water and good water pressure and being ice cold with no pressure - no fun when you have a head full of shampoo and have to wait to rinse off. This hotel was sufficient for a short stay, but I certainly wouldn't go out of my way to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding! What Every Hotel Should Aspire To!”
Reviews.Author: Travelogue74
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Dallas Park Cities is in my opinion the best hotel in Dallas. I have stayed there several times in the past year and plan on staying there exclusively for all of my upcoming trips to Dallas. Firstly, the location is a bit off the beaten path from downtown and the stores and restaurants in the area close in the evening but that is one of the reasons I enjoy this property. It is located in a quite, very nice area of Park Cities just off of the Dallas North Tollway. Unfortunately, this location only has valet parking available but it is not too unreasonable at $18.00 a day - and very convenient as you literally exit your vehicle at the front door of the hotel. What I love most about this hotel is its attention to detail. Upon entering the lobby you feel as if you are in a luxury, boutique hotel. Everything is immaculate, the decor is classy and the hotel staff is extremely efficient, personable and helpful. The rooms are very elegant with high ceilings - at least on the 10th Floor. I have requested the 10th floor ever since because of the extraordinary high ceilings. The decor is very elegant and the room is very inviting. Again, attention to detail is great at this location. Each time I have arrived at this property I have found my bed turned down with chocolates on the pillows, ice in my bucket, with complimentary bottled water awaiting. And, as an even nicer touch, the staff has the clock radio on some kind of smooth jazz station - making your arrival heavenly! The rooms are extremely clean and the bathrooms are great. Very elegant tile floors and a very nice marble sink top grace the bathroom. I must say that the showers are a bit smallish but that is just nitpicking. The bathrooms are also very clean and immaculate. The price is also very reasonable. I believe I have paid from $179 to $249 a night for my stays here. The hotel staff should be commended for keeping up such a great location. I have paid upwards of $600 a night for rooms at places that were nowhere near as good as the Hilton Park Cities. Overall, I recommend the Hilton Park Cities without hesitation. It is classy, clean, elegant, and their attention to detail is outstanding. I easily give this location 5****************** Do yourself a favor and try it when you are in Dallas. It is far superior to any other hotel in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Still a good bet for the Park Cities”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel about five times over the last year. I've gone between it and the W Dallas Victory near downtown. I keep coming back to the Park Cities Hilton because it is consistently clean, quiet, and easy to get to. However, if you need wifi or high-bandwidth internet access, you might choose another location. Usually I choose this hotel because I have business both downtown and up near that Galleria. This hotel offers quick access to those two areas, plus Love Field via the Toll Road. The rooms are normal hotel rooms with fairly stylish furnishings. The beds are quite comfortable. The bathrooms are nice, clean, and have good water pressure. The housekeeping staff does a very nice job making sure the bathrooms are clean and well stocked with extra towels. The major problem I run into with the hotel is the internet access. I've never been able to find wifi access and the in-room ethernet leaves much to be desired. You pay a little under $10 a day for the service and it creeps along at a snails pace. It is hit and miss, at best. If you end up staying here you might consider having dinner at the Taco Diner in the Preston Center. It's a short drive or a quick walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely INCREDILBE!”
Reviews.Author: balvarez
Reviews.Content: From the time I booked this reservation for our anniversary to when we recieved the bill, everything was flawless! The mandatory valet was kind of a pain but that was about it. The front desk employees were very helpful with not only getting into the room but also directions and maps were readily available. We went to the bar and had just very attentive service and the bar itself was very nice and cozy, and when we returned to the room was ready for the evening, bed was put down, lights dimmed, music on and bath robes were on the bed. I had specifically ordered champagne and strawberryies to be delivered without my wife's knowledge and they were when we were at the bar. How did they know when we weren't there? Very nice touch. We had requested an extra pillow and it seemed that when we hung up the phone, the young lady was knocking at the door. She was very gracious and asked if there was anything else she could have done. There wasn't. The next morning, we went to the restaurant for breakfast and it was incredilbe. You HAVE to try the waffles! We requested a late depature time and they were happy to accomodate us. We went shopping the rest of the morning just blocks away! This place is a MUST STAY for anyone! The pool was a bit small but VERY relaxing. Check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: GamecockGirl
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant hotel in a fantastic location, and it's become one of my favorite places to stay when I travel for work. It feels more like a boutique hotel than a typical Hilton, with elegant decor and attentive service. The hotel gym was being renovated when I visited, so I was given a free pass to Gold's Gym (about a block away), along with a hotel towel to use for my workout and a lock for the gym's lockers. I visited the hotel bar to watch some football, and the bartenders were all very good. The food was excellent -- a pleasant surprise for a hotel bar. I highly recommend the house salad, which comes with beets. Delicious! The concierge level snacks and breakfast items were better than most Hilton hotels' offerings. The turndown service is a nice surprise -- chocolates left on my pillow, along with the next day's weather forecast. The room's radio was on and tuned to classical music, and I found ice and two complimentary bottles of water provided each day. The hotel is right in the thick of some good shopping and restaurants. I grabbed lunch at Pei Wei (an Asian diner/bistro with low prices and quick service) and sincerely enjoyed that. Within a short walk are CVS, Ross, and Marshall's. The only complaint I have is that the hotel internet service (which is around $9 a day, if I remember correctly), was SLOW, SLOW, SLOW. Other than the slow Internet service, this hotel visit was a homerun.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: DukeCarlisle
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel whenever I'm in Dallas, which is often. The rooms are attractive and clean, but the most important quality is the attitude and competence of the staff at every level. Like Theo, the consierge, everyone goes out of their way to please and even anticipate my needs. Duke Carlisle, Mississippi

Reviews.Title: “As an foreigner...WOW!!! Thanks for making me feel at HOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: armandok
Reviews.Content: Coming from Mexico and to be treated like was I at this Hilton was incredible. If need you any thing, ask the concierge. He'll give you directions then he will sing to you like you are the only person staying there. The personalized services I recieved from him and the desk front, the restaurante and especially the maids who maid mem feel at home, thank you thank you. The hotel was convenient for shopping and dining and wahtever else you want. The only complaint was the carpet. Looked it old. Definite return!!! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: lmedina02
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel high on my list. The room was very clean and spacious (for the price). I had the 'do not disturb' sign on for most of the day. I left the room for only about 1 hr and when I got back the room was clean and stocked. This tells me that there is great attention to detail and to customer service. The location of this hotel is also a huge plus. It is directly off the Dallas North Tollway and just about 10 min from downtown and North Dallas. Overall it was a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffa1900
Reviews.Content: Front Desk was very accomadating very helpful and room was spacious and immaculate. Theo the concierge was incredible. Booked reservations at local restaurant. Thank you for such a fine experience. The wife appreciated the location; perfect for shopping. Thank you. Jeff

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, comfortable -- excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: DRobertLA
Reviews.Content: This is a solid, well above average hotel -- pleasant personnel, comfortable rooms, and so on. No complaints -- except the comforters are so thick that unless you put the room temp down to 50, you're going to be too hot -- and yet if you take it off, you're then too cold; couldn't they just get a regular blanket or non-polar grade comforter? Anyway, whie not a Four Seasons, it's WAY above an EconoLodge or anything like that. Very good deal for the price. The pool on the roof is basically an enlarged wading pool -- only 3 feet deep and about the size of two hot tubs -- but still, you can get wet in it, and it's pleasant. The pillows are nice, the soaps and such are first-class, the sheets are high-grade, and the valet service had our car up very quickly. It's not posh, but it's comfortable enough for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: SSAPortland
Reviews.Content: I read most of the reviews here and was leery about my weeklong stay in this property. I needn't have worried. We had a lovely time. Our room was clean, comfortable, and everything worked as it should. The dinner we had in the restaurant was great. My husband held a catered meeting and the food was terrific. I found the location excellent for getting to various parts of the city for dinners and shopping; and there are lots of places within walking distance too. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful in making suggestions and giving directions. Two minor complaints: 1) I agree that the walls are thin; and 2) the breakfast fare in the Executive Lounge was a bit spartan.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and stay away!!!”
Reviews.Author: bobakm
Reviews.Content: Forget about service and respect. This is one of the most incompetant group of people I have ever come across in a all my years of traveling. They are rude and dont care about service. The room I was given had a fan above the roof which made a disturbing sound all day and night. Two days in a row I got wake up calls at 6:20 am. repeatedly for 15 minute which I had not even requested. When I complained, no one cared and they even treated me as If I was making it up. They finaly changed my room but the key did not work when I came back from dinner. I told the front desk which happened to be the night manager. He told me that I was not in the room that I had told him but another. I explained that he was wrong and he insisted that I was the one wrong, he made me go up to the wrong room just to prove it. Then when I came back and told him, he actually wanted to move me again. I finaly got to my room and found the extra key in the envelope which had my room # on which proved the manager wrong... He never called to apologize. The hot tub was out of order my whole trip. In the mornings the hot water would just stop working. The hotel gym is a joke and they charger $14 for valet parking which is mandatory. They also had given my room to someone else before my checkin and cancelled my priceline reservation for two nights while charging me for it. I will never stay at this Hilton again even if they comp. me.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: HiltonHonor20YR
Reviews.Content: Not a horrible hotel but definitely not worth $199 a night. Walls are thin, the workout facility is one of the worst I've seen in a Hilton property (equipment is old and outdate, no larger dumbells) and there is no self-parking. Having to wait on valet to bring your car each time is a real pain. For the money I'll stay at a Hilton Garden Inn next time.
